definition: lit. to go up to heaven or down to Hades (idiom)/fig. to go to great lengths/to search heaven and earth
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
day/sky/heaven
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Bosom 18 Ban military skill, can Heaven enter land, possess high-tech weapon.
sentences.chinese: 身怀十八般武艺，能上天入地，拥有高科技的武器。

sentences.english: We're together in the world of music-high on the top of the mountain, deep into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 在音乐的世界里，不管上天入地，我们都要在一起。

definition: to possess great magical power/to possess remarkable abilities
to leap onto roofs and vault over walls (usually associated with martial arts)
omnipotent
come without a shadow, leave without a footprint (idiom); to come and leave without a trace
lit. to move mountains and drain seas/to transform nature
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
to know all under heaven/exceptionally talented (idiom)
Sun Wukong's magical cloud
Daoist immortal/supernatural entity/(in modern fiction) fairy, elf, leprechaun etc/fig. lighthearted person
lit. mountains of daggers and seas of flames/fig. extreme danger (idiom)
to display one's remarkable skill or prowess/to give full play to one's brilliant abilities
demons and ghosts/ghouls and bogies
lit. come without a shadow, leave without a footprint (idiom); to come and go without a trace
pinyin: lai2 wu2 ying3 , qu4 wu2 zong1

definition: superhuman/exceptional
Superman, comic book superhero
Great-Sage Sun/Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1]
Great Sage the Equal of Heaven, self-proclaimed title of the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
